intro: Thlaspi arabicum, commonly known as yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in gardens, fields, and along roadsides. Thlaspi arabicum is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a hardy and adaptable species.
